title: Seeing Europe with Famous Authors, Volume 2; Great Britain and Ireland, Part 2
author: Francis W. Halsey
snippet: My acquaintance, the Reverend Mr. John Macauley, one of the ministers ofInverary, and brother to our good friend at Calder, came to us thismorning, and accompanied us to the castle, where I presented Dr. Johnsonto the Duke of Argyle.

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: — Went from thence through Wentbridge eight miles to Pontefract, finely situated on the top of a hill, there are several good streets and houses and the town well paved, a very handsome  new built church and market house, thence two miles to Castleford  bridge where we passed the river Calder.

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: At our coming out of ^Yakefield we cross the river Calder, over a good strong bridge, on the middle of which on our left hand stands an old chapel, said to have been built by Edward the fourth, or his brother the Earl of rRutland] in which the soul of his father, and of those who fell with him in a battle with Queen [Margaret] , somewhere in this neighbourhood, w^ere to be prayed for (but Leland mentions it as a foundation of the townsmen's, and dedicated to the Virgin) ; the case of it, and the covering is still standing  and entire ; but I am afraid not likely to be reduced to any use for devotion, it being at present only a repository to store up rape seed in.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: This occurrencemade the party somewhat nervous with regard to the fordthrough the river Calder, where the water was certain to bevery much higher, as the " catchment area " of that stream isthe largest in the district.

title: Kriegspiel: the War-Game. [A novel.]
author: Groome, Francis Hindes
snippet: And Calder may send a cab round ; and have somethingfor me to eat about nine, or soon after.

title: Kriegspiel: the War-Game. [A novel.]
author: Groome, Francis Hindes
snippet: " Tell Calder to go over at once to the New Club, and' My compliments and apologies to Lord Bedrule, but Ihave been called out suddenly on a very important case.'
